tasks.title: Initialize Next.js 14+ Project with TypeScript
tasks.description: Set up a new Next.js 14+ project with TypeScript, replacing the existing Vite and React Router setup.
tasks.details:
1. Create a new Next.js project with App Router:
```bash
npx create-next-app@latest . --typescript --tailwind --eslint --app --src-dir
```
2. Configure essential dependencies in package.json:
```json
{
  "dependencies": {
    "next": "^14.0.0",
    "react": "^18.3.0",
    "react-dom": "^18.3.0",
    "@prisma/client": "^5.0.0",
    "zod": "^3.22.0",
    "@tanstack/react-query": "^5.0.0",
    "next-themes": "^0.2.0"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "typescript": "^5.5.0",
    "@types/node": "^20.0.0",
    "@types/react": "^18.2.0",
    "@types/react-dom": "^18.2.0",
    "prisma": "^5.0.0",
    "eslint": "^8.0.0",
    "eslint-config-next": "^14.0.0",
    "prettier": "^3.0.0"
  }
}
```
3. Set up Next.js configuration in next.config.js:
```javascript
/** @type {import('next').NextConfig} */
const nextConfig = {
  reactStrictMode: true,
  swcMinify: true,
  experimental: {
    serverActions: true,
  },
};

module.exports = nextConfig;
```
4. Create basic folder structure according to App Router conventions:
```
/app
  /page.tsx
  /layout.tsx
  /api
/components
/lib
/public
```
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify the project builds without errors: `npm run build`
2. Ensure the development server starts correctly: `npm run dev`
3. Confirm TypeScript is properly configured by checking for type errors: `npx tsc --noEmit`
4. Validate that the App Router structure works by navigating to the home page in the browser
5. Test that the Next.js configuration is applied correctly by checking build output

tasks.title: Configure Code Quality Tools and Git Hooks
tasks.description: Set up ESLint, Prettier, Husky, and lint-staged for code quality enforcement and pre-commit hooks.
tasks.details:
1. Install additional dev dependencies:
```bash
npm install --save-dev husky lint-staged @typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin @typescript-eslint/parser prettier-plugin-tailwindcss
```

2. Configure ESLint in `.eslintrc.js`:
```javascript
module.exports = {
  extends: ['next/core-web-vitals', 'plugin:@typescript-eslint/recommended'],
  parser: '@typescript-eslint/parser',
  plugins: ['@typescript-eslint'],
  rules: {
    '@typescript-eslint/no-unused-vars': ['error', { argsIgnorePattern: '^_' }],
    'no-console': ['warn', { allow: ['warn', 'error'] }],
  },
};
```

3. Configure Prettier in `.prettierrc`:
```json
{
  "semi": true,
  "singleQuote": true,
  "tabWidth": 2,
  "trailingComma": "es5",
  "printWidth": 100,
  "plugins": ["prettier-plugin-tailwindcss"]
}
```

4. Set up Husky and lint-staged:
```bash
npx husky-init && npm install
npx husky add .husky/pre-commit "npx lint-staged"
```

5. Configure lint-staged in `package.json`:
```json
{
  "lint-staged": {
    "*.{js,jsx,ts,tsx}": [
      "eslint --fix",
      "prettier --write"
    ],
    "*.{json,css,md}": [
      "prettier --write"
    ]
  }
}
```

6. Add scripts to `package.json`:
```json
{
  "scripts": {
    "lint": "next lint",
    "lint:fix": "next lint --fix",
    "format": "prettier --write .",
    "type-check": "tsc --noEmit"
  }
}
```
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Run ESLint to verify configuration: `npm run lint`
2. Test Prettier formatting: `npm run format`
3. Verify TypeScript type checking: `npm run type-check`
4. Test Husky pre-commit hooks by making a commit with linting errors
5. Ensure lint-staged correctly processes staged files before commit

tasks.title: Implement Email Verification for User Registration
tasks.description: Set up a complete email verification system for user registration, including email service integration, verification tokens, sending emails, and handling verification endpoints.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test email service integration:
   - Verify API keys are correctly configured in environment variables

   - Verify email content and formatting is correct

2. Test verification token generation:
   - Verify tokens are generated with correct expiration times
   - Test that old tokens are deleted when new ones are created
   - Verify token uniqueness

3. Test user registration with email verification:
   - Register a new user and confirm verification email is sent
   - Check database to confirm user is created with emailVerified set to null
   - Verify verification token is created in the database

4. Test email verification process:
   - Test verification endpoint with valid tokens
   - Test with expired tokens
   - Test with invalid tokens
   - Verify user's emailVerified field is updated after successful verification

5. Test login with verification requirement:
   - Attempt to login with unverified email (should be rejected)
   - Verify user with verified email can login successfully
   - Test error messages for unverified accounts

6. Test resend verification functionality:
   - Test resending verification email for existing unverified users
   - Test with already verified users
   - Test with non-existent email addresses
   - Verify new token is generated when resending

7. Test verification UI:
   - Test verification page with valid token parameter
   - Test with invalid/expired token
   - Test with missing token
   - Verify proper success/error messages are displayed

8. Integration testing:
   - Test the complete flow from registration to verification to login
   - Verify NextAuth.js integration works correctly with email verification
   - Test that protected routes remain inaccessible until email is verified

9. Security testing:
   - Verify tokens are properly invalidated after use
   - Test for timing attacks by ensuring consistent response times
   - Verify proper error handling without leaking sensitive information

tasks.title: Configure Deployment Documentation
tasks.description: Create comprehensive deployment documentation covering production environment setup, CI/CD pipeline configuration, environment variables, database migrations, deployment checklists, and rollback procedures.
tasks.details:
1. Document Production Environment Setup:
```markdown
# Production Environment Setup

## Infrastructure Requirements
- Server specifications (CPU, RAM, storage)
- Network configuration
- Required services (Redis, PostgreSQL, etc.)
- Domain and SSL certificate setup

## Installation Steps
- Operating system configuration
- Node.js installation and version requirements
- Database setup
- Web server configuration (Nginx/Apache)
- Security considerations
```

2. Create CI/CD Pipeline Configuration Documentation:
```markdown
# CI/CD Pipeline Configuration

## GitHub Actions Workflow
```yaml
name: Deploy to Production

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main ]

jobs:
  deploy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          node-version: '18'
          cache: 'npm'
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci
      - name: Run tests
        run: npm test
      - name: Build application
        run: npm run build
      - name: Deploy to production
        # Deployment steps here
```

## Deployment Process
- Code quality checks
- Test execution
- Build process
- Deployment strategy (Blue/Green, Canary, etc.)
- Post-deployment verification
```

3. Document Environment Variables:
```markdown
# Environment Variables

## Required Variables
| Variable Name | Description | Example Value | Required |
|---------------|-------------|--------------|----------|
| DATABASE_URL | PostgreSQL connection string | postgresql://user:pass@localhost:5432/db | Yes |
| NEXTAUTH_SECRET | Secret for NextAuth.js | complex-random-string | Yes |
| NEXTAUTH_URL | Base URL for NextAuth.js | https://example.com | Yes |
| OAUTH_CLIENT_ID | OAuth provider client ID | client-id-value | Yes |
| OAUTH_CLIENT_SECRET | OAuth provider client secret | client-secret-value | Yes |

## Optional Variables
| Variable Name | Description | Default Value | Required |
|---------------|-------------|--------------|----------|
| LOG_LEVEL | Application logging level | info | No |
| CACHE_TTL | Cache time-to-live in seconds | 3600 | No |

## Environment-Specific Configuration
- Development vs. Production settings
- Secrets management best practices
- Using .env files vs. environment variables
```

4. Document Database Migration Process:
```markdown
# Database Migration Process

## Pre-Deployment Steps
1. Create a database backup:
```bash
pg_dump -U username -d database_name > backup_$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S).sql
```

2. Review migration changes:
```bash
npx prisma migrate diff --from-schema-datamodel prisma/schema.prisma --to-schema-datasource DATABASE_URL
```

## Deployment Steps
1. Run migrations in production:
```bash
npx prisma migrate deploy
```

2. Verify migration success:
```bash
npx prisma db pull
```

## Rollback Procedure
1. Restore from backup:
```bash
psql -U username -d database_name < backup_file.sql
```

2. Revert to previous schema version (if using Prisma):
```bash
npx prisma migrate resolve --rolled-back "migration_name"
```
```

5. Create Deployment Checklists:
```markdown
# Deployment Checklist

## Pre-Deployment
- [ ] All tests passing in CI pipeline
- [ ] Database backup created
- [ ] Deployment plan reviewed
- [ ] Required environment variables configured
- [ ] Monitoring systems ready
- [ ] Team notified of upcoming deployment

## Deployment
- [ ] Maintenance mode enabled (if applicable)
- [ ] Database migrations applied
- [ ] Application code deployed
- [ ] Static assets updated
- [ ] Cache cleared (if applicable)
- [ ] Smoke tests executed

## Post-Deployment
- [ ] Application health checks passing
- [ ] Error rates normal
- [ ] Performance metrics within expected ranges
- [ ] Sample user flows tested
- [ ] Maintenance mode disabled (if applicable)
- [ ] Deployment logged in change management system
```

6. Document Rollback Procedures:
```markdown
# Rollback Procedures

## When to Rollback
- Critical functionality broken
- Unacceptable performance degradation
- Security vulnerability introduced
- Data integrity issues

## Rollback Process
1. Decision to rollback made by [role/team]
2. Notify team of rollback decision
3. Enable maintenance mode
4. Restore previous application version:
```bash
# Example rollback command
git checkout v1.2.3
npm ci
npm run build
# Redeploy previous version
```
5. Restore database to pre-migration state (if needed)
6. Verify application functionality
7. Disable maintenance mode
8. Notify team of completed rollback
9. Document rollback in incident report

## Post-Rollback Actions
- Root cause analysis
- Fix issues in development
- Improve testing to catch similar issues
- Update deployment process if needed
```

7. Compile all documentation into a single deployment guide:
```markdown
# Deployment Guide

## Table of Contents
1. Production Environment Setup
2. CI/CD Pipeline Configuration
3. Environment Variables
4. Database Migration Process
5. Deployment Checklist
6. Rollback Procedures

## Introduction
This guide provides comprehensive instructions for deploying the application to production environments...
```
